conbody.p:
A user profile provides a specialization of a business activity to a user or a group of users. Examples of user profiles are:
Relationship Manager
Marketing Officer
Administrator
Default
The models that can change between user profiles are:
Menu
Page
Module
Fragment
While menu items or page content may differ from one user profile to another, domain and pageflow remain the same whatever the user profile.

User profiles can also potentially be organized hierarchically. This means that profiles can share a common parent profile artifact. When a page or module is not specialized in the connected user's profile, the system automatically looks into the parent profile as well as in the default profile. The default profile is always available in Design Studio model projects.

A user profile is materialized by a package that is placed at the same level of the "Default" package in the models project tree. The profile hierarchy is recognized by the system thanks to a dot between the parent and child in the package name. For instance, RelationShipManager.Junior and RelationShipManager.Senior are two user profiles where RelationShipManager is the head of two sub-profiles.
For more information, refer to Triple'A Plus Advanced Customisation Guide.
